descript.abstract: Provide average transit speeds, number of trips, and metrics related to scheduled annd real-time service minutes by route-direction and time-of-day.
descript.purpose: Average transit speeds by route-direction and time-of-day estimated on a single day for all CA transit operators that provide GTFS real-time vehicle positions data.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Full name of the transit agency
A standardized route_name for the route_id (can be route_short_name, route_long_name, or route_desc)

Indicates the direction of travel for a trip. This field should not be used in routing; it provides a way to separate trips by direction when publishing time tables. Valid options are 0 - Travel in one direction (e.g. outbound travel). 1 - Travel in the opposite direction (e.g. inbound travel).
The time of day period that provides average speeds. Valid values are Early AM, AM Peak, Midday, PM Peak, Evening, Owl.
The average speed_mph for all trips with vehicle positions for that time-of-day.
The number of trips used to calculate the average speed_mph for that time-of-day.
The average scheduled trip (minutes) for trips occurring in that time-of-day period. Derived from the `service_hours` in GTFS scheduled trips.

The average real-time trip (minutes) elapsed for trips with vehicle positions occurring in that time-of-day period. Strictly speaking, it is not the number of minutes to complete the trips, but the number of minutes with real-time vehicle positions observed for that shape_id.
The base64 encoded url for the feed associated with the agency

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
